alert.note: Alert for Barry (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 10:43AM EDT until April 07 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County. .Recent heavy rain, combined with several additional rounds of rain over the next few days, will lead to minor flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Thornapple River Above Hastings. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of Tyden Park in Hastings, and homes upstream and downstream of Hastings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon and crest around 7.1 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 06/30/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
